feed.title: Combined summary - TXMempool and dirty entries

entry.title: Combined summary - TXMempool and dirty entries
entry.summary: The bitcoin-dev mailing list has been moved to bcc, a forum that is better suited for Bitcoin Core implementation specifics rather than general Bitcoin development. The work limit was removed in preparation for ancestor-feerate-mining, and comments were cleaned up to match the new code. Users can file an issue or open a PR to update those comments on the Github repository. DJ Bitcoin posted a question on the use of txmempool on the bitcoin-dev mailing list, specifically regarding the concept of "dirty" entries. CTxMemPoolEntry's nCountWithDescendants variable is never zero; therefore, DJ Bitcoin asked where this concept of "dirty" is defined. Unfortunately, no further context is provided to generate a more detailed summary.
